DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time when image pixel data creation started, displayed in the format hhmmss.frac; where hh (00-23); minutes (00-59); seconds (00-59); frac=fractional part "000000"-"999999". Required if image is part of a series in which the images are temporally related.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The time when image pixel data creation started. Required if image is part of aseries in which the images are temporally related.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.:The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past; a specific point in this continuum or the interval separating two points.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/26/09 changed property concept to "start" instead of content; added text short name, chg concpetual domain to "Medical Imaging" & released.   5/20/07-2007 DICOM Standard - Sections 3

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: TM:  DICOM Time; A string of characters of the format hhmmss.frac; where hh (00-23); minutes (00-59); seconds (00-59); frac=fractional part "000000"-"999999"

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 12/16/09 - chg reg status to Proposed  8/26/09 relased with updated DEC.  6/24/07 -CDE created to support DICOM CDE IE - DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.;  CDE supports DICOM Standard PS 3 - 2004.
